venue.name: Mass AT: Race Brook Falls Trailhead

item.description:
All right everyone… let’s get our hike on!!! For a limited time only (meaning this week, because by next week it will all have happened) we here @ RI Outdoors will be offering a weekend hike to begin all weekend hikes. This Saturday & Sunday (4/7 & 4/8) join us on one or both days as we open the doors to our “Not-So-Ancient Archives of Past Hikes” and pluck from our coffers, the first two hikes that started the "Mass-AT Mania" we know today: Leg of Mass-AT #1 & Leg of Mass-AT #2.

For your enjoyment, we'll prepare our legs by braising them over a hardwood fire, which will then be accompanied by a stock reduction seasoned w/ coriander and fennel; for the side-dish, roasted spring vegetables (mint jelly not included). Seriously... don’t be surprised if by day's end your legs are feeling a little over-done, especially if you haven’t hiked during the winter months. Also, if one leg of the Mass-AT is not enough for you, a few of us are planning to spend the night, on-trial & in-town, so that we can knock-off a 2nd portion on Sunday.

Disclaimer: We here @ RI Outdoors do not believe in roasting, braising, grilling, or for that matter, cooking any of our Meetup members; legs, arms, thighs or any other body part will not be BBQ'd, no matter how delicious one might appear to be.

Note: This posting is for April 7th, see separate posting for April 8th, and should you plan to stay overnight, either in-wood or in-town, please sign up for both days. Thank you.

And to our vegetarian members: I apologize, I just couldn't come up with a suitable "leg of vegetable" metaphor (ears of corn... yes; potato eyes... yes; but no leg of...).

So without further ado, here are the plans for Saturday's hike (Mike, this is where you begin reading):

We will meet at the Race Brook Falls Trailhead, which will be the ending location of our hike. We'll then carspot and drive down Rt 41 to the Undermountain Trailhead in Salisbury, CT. Because there is no easy entrance to the AT at the Massachusetts border, we will hike through about 3 1/2 miles of Connecticut (Boo!!!) before we start our Mass-AT journey (Yay!). Along the way we will hit some great scenic spots, including Bear Mountain (Yay!!!), Sages Ravine (Double Yay!!), Race Mountain, and Race Brook Falls. Total hike: 10.5 miles through challenging terrain with a total elevation gain approximated at 2500' (1500' up to Bear Mountain, & another 1000 or so as we hike along the AT).

PS: No animals were hurt during the writing of this description.


EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Cool Weather/Spring Essentials (required):
• Synthetic Quick-drying Pants
• Synthetic Quick-drying L/S Shirt
• Sturdy Hiking Boots/shoes (preferably waterproof)
• Synthetic/Wool Socks
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket
• Light/Mid-weight Insulating Layers (undershirt/underpants)
• Extra pair of Socks
• Hat/Gloves
• Rain/Soft Shell Jacket/Pants
• Water (2-3L)
• Headlamp/Flashlight
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)


the Remaining Essentials:
• Medications/First Aid Supplies
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's hardly a reason not to have one in your pack)
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellant/Toiletries
• Light-weight Wind Jacket (if your insulated or rain jacket isn’t windproof)
• Hand Warmers
• Trekking Poles
• Gaiters
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter
• Camera/Binoculars

 

Is This Hike for Me?

This is a lengthy hike over difficult terrain with some decent elevation gains. We will have to move at good pace because of the length of the hike so I ask that only experienced hikers in good physical condition sign up. I'm limiting the numbers on this hike so please only sign up if you are sure you can make it (which really always applies, but its worth calling out). Please bring plenty of water (I'm bringing 2-3 liters) appropriate hiking attire (no jeans or cotton clothing, wear hiking boots not sneakers), rain gear in case the weather turns nasty, lunch, and snacks. Do expect some muddy trails, and certainly don't expect to get out of this one with clean boots!


Route Information:

1.9 miles on the Undermountain Trail to its junction with the Appalachian Trail.

.9 miles to Bear Mountain summit(2,316 ft). Great views from the top of Connecticut's highest mountain.

.7 miles to the MA/CT border.

3.9 miles to Race Mountain summit(2,372 ft). 360 degree views!

1.1 miles to the intersection with the Race Brook Falls Trail

2 miles down to the parking area along a series of waterfalls

 

 


Trailhead Directions:

From Providence 2 hours 45 minutes

From Newport 3 hours 10 minutes

From MA Turnpike: Take Exit 2 off of Rt 90, follow Rt 102 west to Stockbridge, turn left (south) onto Rt 7 towards Great Barrington. Continue south on Rt 7 turning right onto Rt 41-S/Rt 23-W (Maple Avenue), and follow for approx. 10 miles, thru South Egremont; bear left and follow Rt 41-S at the Rt 41/Rt 23 split. The trailhead is located past the Berkshire School diagonally across from the Rt 41/Salisbury Rd intersection.

Google Maps: http://maps.google.com/maps?saddr=US-20+E%2FHousatonic+St&daddr=MA-41+S%2FS+Undermountain+Rd&hl=en&ll=42.14686,-73.269539&spn=0.152474,0.301781&sll=42.089079,-73.411092&sspn=0.019...

Coordinates: 42.089478, -73.411248


Carpool Option:

Please use the comments section to coordinate with other hikers if you want to carpool.
